business.headline: Meet Alakh Pandey, the young Edtech visionary behind Physics WallahFrom a humble tutor to a trailblazing entrepreneur, Alakh Pandey's journey with Physics Wallah shows how passion and perseverance can turn even the simplest beginnings into a $2.8 billion empire—reshaping education, one formula at a time.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: S Jaishankar's 'karma' jibe at Pak: Their GDP measured in terms of radicalisationPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, in his speech to the UNGA on Friday, compared the situation in Jammu and Kashmir to that of Palestine, saying the people had "struggled for a century for their freedom and right to self-determination".

Hezbollah confirms Hassan Nasrallah's death in Israeli airstrike in Beirut Hezbollah confirmed the killing of its leader, Hassan Nasrallah, in a massive Israeli airstrike on the group's headquarters in Beirut, which also claimed the lives of several other commanders, marking a significant blow to the Iran-backed terror outfit.

Another 'son rise' in Tamil Nadu as Udhayanidhi promoted as MK Stalin's deputyAfter being delayed by controversies, elections, and other recent crises, Tamil Nadu Sports Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin, son of Chief Minister MK Stalin, is set to become the state's new Deputy Chief Minister on Sunday.

Hezbollah chief's killing sparks protest in J&K, Mehbooba Mufti calls him martyrMehbooba Mufti announced that her party's campaign for the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly election will be called off on Sunday in solidarity with the people of Palestine and Lebanon, particularly in response to the killing of Hezbollah chief.

Censorship on OTT: Curbing creativity or supporting sensitivity? Celebs discussWith so much available to watch online, are we fine with the idea of absolute freedom or do we need a body to regulate the content and tell us what is right for us to watch? India Today digital spoke to celebs across the film industry to understand the idea of having censorship on OTT platforms.

1 cop killed, another injured in gunfight with Jaish terrorists in J&K's KathuaAn Assistant Sub-Inspector of the Jammu-Kashmir was killed after the security forces engaged three to four Jaish terrorists in Kathua's Bilawar area.

Varun Chakravarthy returns, Mayank Yadav called up as India announce T20I squadThe BCCI announced the squad for the upcoming three-match T20I series against Bangladesh set to begin from October 6. Mayank Yadav has earned his maiden India call up while Varun Chakravarthy has returned to the side after three years.

IPL players to get richer, BCCI announces Rs 7.5 lakh match fee from 2025 seasonThe BCCI introduced a match fee of Rs 7.5 lakh for players ahead of IPL 2025. The players who will play all the games in the league will get an additional Rs 1.05 crore alongside their contract amount.

Crew-9 mission to return Sunita Williams from space launchedThis flight features only two crew members instead of the usual four, as the remaining seats are reserved for Williams and Wilmore's return journey.

Kingmakers in 2024: Can 'Others' damage Congress prospects in Haryana?In 2009 and 2019, Haryana's voters gave marginally fractured mandates, with the Congress and the BJP winning 40 seats each respectively, the halfway mark being 46.

Tamil Nadu Cabinet rejig: Senthil Balaji re-inducted, 3 ministers droppedChief Minister MK Stalin recommended Senthil Balaji's name, alongside Dr Govi Chezhiaan, R Rajendran, and SM Nasar, to be inducted into the council of ministers, which Governor RN Ravi approved.

Israel settled score by killing Hezbollah chief, says Benjamin NetanyahuIn his first public statement since Israel killed Nasrallah, Netanyahu said that Israel has "settled the account" with a "mass murderer" responsible for the killings of several Israelis and many American and French citizens, The Times of Israel reported.

IPL announces landmark retention and auction rules for 2025 season: ExplainedThe Indian Premier League Governing Council announced the Player regulations for the 2025 season as several landmark decisions were taken for the next three editions of the T20 extravaganza.

BookMyShow on Coldplay concert ticketing issue: We ensured every fan a fair chanceBookMyShow addresses concerns over the black market sale of Coldplay tickets, clarifying its fair ticketing measures. It also stated that it has no association with any unauthorised ticket-selling platforms.

Is it better to be overdressed or underdressed? While glamming up, we often face a familiar dilemma: should we go all out and dazzle, or play it cool and understated? Let's find out from experts whether it's better to be overdressed or underdressed.

Operation New Order: Israel says Nasrallah dead, will no longer terrorise worldHassan Nasrallah, the elusive and secretive Hezbollah chief, was killed in the massive airstrike in Beirut targeting the Hezbollah headquarters.

Indian-American CEO's witty reply to X user who called him 'untrained engineer'Nikesh Arora, an Indian-American business executive, gave a witty reply to a user on X who claimed he wasn't a trained engineer.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Watch: Aishwarya Rai touches 'guru' Mani Ratnam's feet at IIFA UtsavamActor Aishwarya Rai touched filmmaker Mani Ratnam's feet at IIFA Utsavam 2024 after presenting him with the Best Director award for Ponniyin Selvan II.  Watch the video of the heartfelt moment here.

Zionist regime hasn't learned: Iran Supreme Leader on Hezbollah chief's killingAfter the Israeli military on Saturday claimed that they had eliminated Hezbollah leader Nasrallah in Beirut airstrikes, Khamenei was moved to a secure location with increased security measures as reported by Al Arabiya News, citing sources.

Alia Bhatt celebrates Ranbir Kapoor's 42nd with cutest family pics featuring RahaOn Ranbir Kapoor's 42nd birthday, Alia Bhatt shared heartwarming photos featuring him and their daughter Raha. Family members expressed love and best wishes as Ranbir embarks on his entrepreneurial journey.

Case against Nirmala Sitharaman over 'extortion' through electoral bonds A complaint against Nirmala Sitharaman and others was filed by one Adarsh Iyer from the Janaadhikara Sangharsha Sanghatane, alleging that extortion was carried out through electoral bonds.

Hassan Nasrallah dead. Who will lead Hezbollah against an aggressive Israel?The second-in-command of Hezbollah, Hashem Safieddine, is likely to succeed Nasrallah. However, some reports claimed that Safieddine was also killed in the Beirut airstrike.

Raj Kundra denies link with arrested Bangladeshi adult film actor: Never met herBusinessman Raj Kundra refuted claims that Bangladeshi adult film actor Riya Arvinda Barde, arrested for illegally residing in India, was employed by any of his production companies, calling the allegations false and damaging to his reputation.

Aishwarya Rai, daughter Aaradhya return after attending IIFA Utsavam 2024Aishwarya Rai Bachchan is back in Mumbai after attending IIFA Utsavam 2024. She was accompanied by her daughter Aaradhya Bachchan. The mother-daughter duo were all smiles as they were clicked at the airport today.

Director Anubhav Sinha calls IC 814 controversy 'gobar': It's confusingAnubhav Sinha addressed the controversy over his Netflix series IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack, expressing confusion over mixed reactions from the viewers.

Ranbir Kapoor enjoys birthday with paps ahead of family outing with Alia Bhatt, RahaActor Ranbir Kapoor, who turned 42 on Saturday, September 28, celebrated the special day with his fans, family, and paparazzi. He took his daughter Raha out for an outing on his birthday.

sports.headline: IPL announces landmark retention and auction rules for 2025 season: ExplainedThe Indian Premier League Governing Council announced the Player regulations for the 2025 season as several landmark decisions were taken for the next three editions of the T20 extravaganza.

MS Dhoni to continue playing for CSK? IPL brings back uncapped player rule for 2025The IPL governing council re-introduced the uncapped player rule for the IPL 2025 which could pave the path for Dhoni's return in the next season of the tournament.
IPL 2025 rules: BCCI to ban players for pulling out after auction dealThe BCCI and the IPL governing council will ban the players for pulling out of the league after the auction deal.

Pace King Mayank Yadav earns maiden India call-up after overcoming injury woesThe newest fast bowling sensation, Mayank Yadav, earned his maiden India call-up, overcoming injury concerns. He is part of India's 15-member squad vs Bangladesh for the 3-match T20I series.

Mayank Yadav has earned his maiden India call up while Varun Chakravarthy has returned to the side after three years.

IPL 2025 retention rules: 6 retentions and RTM with total purse of Rs 146 croreThe Indian Premier League (IPL) Governing Council announced retention rules for the ten franchises ahead of the mega auction for the upcoming season. All teams have been allowed to retain six players and will also be given Right to Match cards.

With England managing his return carefully, Archer is focusing on taking it "series by series" for now.

Manchester United face Tottenham test at home: All you need to know'Erik ten Hag's Manchester United face a crucial test against Tottenham Hotspur, with pressure mounting after a poor start to the season. A win at Old Trafford could reignite their campaign and restore faith in the Dutch manager.

Kane Williamson surpasses Virat Kohli in major list on Day 3 of 2nd Test vs SLStar New Zealand batter Kane Williamson left Virat Kohli behind in the list of leading run scorers in Test cricket during his 46-run knock against Sri Lanka on Day 3 of the second Test at Galle.

Parthiv reveals reason behind Hardik bowling with red ball amid Test return rumoursParthiv Patel opened up about Hardik Pandya bowling with a red ball and revealed that he opted for the red cherry as the white ball wasn't available for practice.

Brandon's 'matured' return to Mumbai City FC with his passion intactBrandon Fernandes returns to Mumbai City FC with experience and resilience, aiming for club glory once again. Despite a challenging start to the season, the playmaker is confident of turning things around for the defending ISL champions.

Blundell, Phillips hold fort for NZ, after Prabath Jayasuriya runs riot on Day 3New Zealand are staring down at a 0-2 series defeat against Sri Lanka as they were reeling at 199/5 at stumps on Day 3 of the second Test at Galle International Stadium, Galle.

Zaheer Khan picks Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami in 'fab four' of fast bowlersZaheer Khan picked Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami in his list of 'fab four' for fast bowlers. He also picked Kagiso Rabada, Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood among current crop of bowlers.

Don't particularly like term 'bazball': Jason Gillespie before PAK vs ENG TestsPakistan Test team's coach Jason Gillespie expressed his dislike towards the term 'bazball' ahead of the series against England. The English side will tour Pakistan for three-match Test series, starting October 7.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag provides Leny Yoro recovery updateManchester United boss Erik ten Hag has said that Leny Yoro is on the right track with his injury recovery. Yoro was injured during United's pre-season tour in the US.

Musheer Khan stable after road accident but set to be out of action for 3 monthsMumbai cricketer Musheer Khan is set to be ruled out for at least three months in the upcoming domestic season due to a neck fracture sustained in a car accident in Lucknow.

Rohan Bopanna and partner Ivan Dodig suffer shock exit in China Open first roundRohan Bopanna and Ivan Dodig suffered a shock first-round exit at the China Open, falling 5-7, 6-7 to Francisco Cerundolo and Nicolas Jarry. The loss comes after Bopanna's strong season, including titles at the Australian Open and Miami Open.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
